title: 14,000 contractual workers of National Health Mission quit as stir enters 19th day in Chhattisgarh
content: Protest poses two-pronged challenge to BJP govt., with health services severely hit, Oppn. criticising handling of the issue; four of 10 demands accepted, says govt. official; issue notifications: protesters

title: Passenger holding areas planned at Secunderabad station ahead of festive rush
content: To ease congestion on the platforms and foot overbridges, two holding areas will be set up on Platform 1 with a combined capacity of 1,500 passengers

title: PCB data declares Hyderabad ‘quiet’, residents decry late-night din
content: On August 31, the daytime decibel level recorded at Paradise was 37.71 dB. This is quieter than an office or library that will have the sound level of 40 dB

title: Chief Minister Naidu urges teachers to bring in innovation to help today’s tech-savvy students
content: Chief Minister asks teachers to embrace technology and use AI tools and quantum computing to guide students, says educators cannot afford to lag behind their own students or even their children and grandchildren in terms of technology

title: Congress moves High Court against expanded size of Chhattisgarh Cabinet, calls it unconstitutional
content: The induction of three Ministers following the expansion on August 20 takes the size of the Cabinet to 14 in the 90-member Assembly, which breaches the Constitutional limit of 15%, the civil writ petition filed by the party said

title: Caste census: Panel preps up with 60 questions to be posed to 7 crore people
content: The caste list is expected to be have over 1,800 community names in the State at the start of the survey on Septermber 22

title: Caught in trade war, Andhra’s aquaculture faces collapse
content: Over the past four decades, the export-oriented aquaculture in Andhra Pradesh offered sustenance to hundreds of thousands of people from across the country and shored up rural economy. The steep hike in U.S. tariff on Indian goods, however, has cast a shadow of uncertainty over the sector and the lives it supports, writes Rajulapudi Srinivas

title: Rattling the nuts and bolts in Ludhiana
content: Punjab’s industrial hub – known for engineering tools, textiles, and basmati rice exports – braces for the U.S. tariff fallout. While the ripple effects are not immediate, early signs such as reduced working hours and cost-cutting in factories point to an imminent impact on production and livelihoods across industrial sectors. Vikas Vasudeva finds that business owners are currently holding off on layoffs despite an order slump

title: Meitei group rejects Government’s SoO pact extension with Kuki-Zo groups in Manipur
content: COCOMI, one of the largest Meitei civil society groups in Manipur, says the decision taken by Centre “reflects an undemocratic and hegemonic imposition upon the indigenous people and its elected representatives of Manipur”

title: New technology, innovation conclave to ‘replace’ Science Congress to be held in November
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to attend the inauguration of ESTIC; the Indian Science Congress has not been held after 2023 following a spat between DST and ISCA

title: New book on Operation Sindoor is benchmark for future military strategy, says Army Chief
content: Book by retired Lt. Gen. K.J.S. Dhillon is a tribute to Army’s courage and professionalism, says Gen. Dwivedi and adds Operation Sindoor reflected India’s resolve, strategic clarity, whole-of-nation approach

title: Collateral consequences of Ukraine conflict, including fuel price, affecting Global South: India tells UNGA
content: Underscoring that the wholehearted participation and commitment of all stakeholders is critical for lasting peace, India told the UN General Assembly that it welcomes the ‘recent positive developments’ in this direction

title: Reprieve from rain, still northern States grapple with aftermath of monsoon
content: Water levels in dams and rivers drop as the rain has taken a break while the IMD has predicted light to moderate rainfall at most to many places over the country’s northwest and west region during the next seven days. Many residential areas and farmland are still underwater

title: Judge returning to RF for first time since July
content: Yankees star Aaron Judge is returning to the outfield for the first time since coming off the injured list Aug. 5 from a flexor strain in his right arm.

title: Steelers' Heyward 'preparing' to play vs. Jets
content: Cameron Heyward said Friday he's "preparing" when asked if he was going to play on Sunday, but he didn't commit to being on the field for the team's season opener against the Jets.

title: Suárez banned 6 games for spitting at rival staffer
content: Inter Miami striker Luis Suárez has been given a six-game suspension for spitting at a Seattle Sounders staff member following Sunday's Leagues Cup final.

title: Bucs giving CB McCollum 3-year, $48M extension
content: The Buccaneers and cornerback Zyon McCollum have reached agreement on a three-year, $48 million contract extension, his agents told ESPN.

title: Saints DE Young, G Penning out vs. Cardinals
content: Saints defensive end Chase Young and offensive guard Trevor Penning will not play against the Cardinals, Saints coach Kellen Moore said Friday.

title: Mets send down struggling Senga to Triple-A
content: The Mets have optioned Kodai Senga to Triple-A after the right-hander posted a 6.56 ERA over his past eight starts.

title: Vols' Whitehorn pleads guilty to 2 misdemeanors
content: Tennessee starting guard Ruby Whitehorn pleaded guilty Friday to two misdemeanors in exchange for judicial diversion stemming from an altercation last month that resulted in her suspension by the team.

title: Umps take Trammell's bat after Yankees appeal
content: The ninth inning of the Yankees' 8-4 win over the Astros on Thursday night was delayed after umpires confiscated a bat used by Astros outfielder Taylor Trammell.

title: ⚾ Ranking MLB cores: The teams with most talent
content: Dodgers or Mariners? Mets or Phillies? We rank the clubs with the most star power under control through 2027.

title: Connelly: 28 games that could make Week 2 very interesting
content: Get set for two big brands trying to look the part in a unique helmet game, some big tests for Big Ten hopefuls and the Group of 5's biggest weekend.

title: 'He changed for the better of the game': How Jim Harbaugh has evolved as Chargers coach
content: From San Francisco to Ann Arbor to Los Angeles, Jim Harbaugh's coaching style has changed through the years.

title: NFL's youngest head coach hopes to follow in his father's winning footsteps
content: A head coach at 37 and a former QB himself, Kellen Moore aims to get New Orleans back to the postseason.

title: Will Fever make playoffs? Can Liberty still host? Breaking down the WNBA playoff picture
content: Six teams have clinched WNBA playoff bids, but seeding and the last two berths still need to be determined.

title: 30 years later, remembering Ripken's record-setting streak
content: Thirty years after the epic night Cal Ripken set his Ironman streak, he and others remember the magic.

title: Who's next? Tiering Hall of Fame chances for 50 active NBA stars
content: From top-75 locks to vets on the bubble, Zach Kram runs down the active NBA players on the path to Springfield.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Seven potential difference-makers for Week 1
content: Liz Loza lays out the facts that affect her Week 1 fantasy football feelings on Baker Mayfield and others.

title: How much will Tucker get? Who could sign Schwarber? Passan's early free agency intel
content: MLB front offices are already thinking ahead to the offseason. Here are the storylines that will rule the winter.

title: To call plays or not to call plays ... that's the question for many top head coaches
content: Coaches like Mike Norvell and Ryan Day were known for calling plays. If they need or want to stop, things get interesting.

title: Why Michigan has already rallied behind Bryce Underwood
content: With comparisons to Trevor Lawrence ahead of an early test against Oklahoma, the lore around the nation's No. 1 freshman is growing.

title: Key matchups, fantasy intel and predictions for Week 1's remaining 15 games
content: Here's everything you need to know for Week 1 NFL games. Which teams will win, who are the X factors, and which storylines matter most?

title: Sabalenka vs. Anisimova: Who will win the US Open title?
content: No. 1 Sabalenka will take on No. 8 Anisimova in the US Open final Saturday. Who will prevail? It's not as straightforward as it seems on paper.

title: What are the odds? Top 25 predicted anytime NFL TD scorers for Week 1
content: Mike Clay's reveals his top 25 predicted touchdown scorers for Week 1, comparing implied odds to ESPN BET's.

title: Pochettino, Pulisic must reconcile for USMNT to be at its best
content: Ahead of next summer's World Cup on home soil, it will be important for USMNT manager Mauricio Pochettino and star player Christian Pulisic to rebuild their relationship.

title: NCAA, NHL rule change reactions, Schaefer ready for Islanders
content: The incoming first-year class offered its take on several significant topics ahead of the 2025-26 season.

title: 'I got one more ring from it': Travis Kelce talks engagement to Taylor Swift in Brazil
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end kept things lighthearted about his relationship and engagement to the superstar singer/songwriter.

title: Rankings for the 2026 NFL draft: Top prospects at every position
content: Who are the best players at every position? Our analysts give their top-fives, plus their combined overall top-10 ranking for the 2026 class.

title: James Madison's icy white look headlines best Week 2 college football uniforms
content: James Madison will look to make a statement on the road against Louisville wearing a slick all-white look.

title: Chargers powder blue, Chiefs' traditional look in Brazil top NFL Week 1 threads
content: Here's a look at the Week 1 uniforms for all 32 NFL teams, led by the Saints debuting their gold uniforms.

title: Why Daniel Levy has left Tottenham after 25 years as chairman
content: Levy, 63, has established himself as one of the most respected executives in soccer, but Thursday saw him stepping down in a seismic move. How did it happen, and what will his legacy look like?

title: 50 most expensive transfers of summer window, ranked by true cost: Isak isn't No. 1
content: There's how much a transfer costs, and then there's what a club can afford to pay. We've ranked the *actual* 50 most expensive transfers of the 2025 summer window.

title: Ahead of Monza, why Mercedes is keeping faith in Antonelli
content: Kimi Antonelli is the 18-year-old next big thing of Formula 1, and ahead of his return to Monza, he will continue to prove that at Mercedes.

title: Watch: Modi, Xi, Putin get closer | Photo-op, or warning to the West?
content: From Trump tariffs to the Tianjin troika - does the Modi-Xi-Putin pow-wow mean more than a photo-op? After the SCO meet and China’s military parade, can India’s eastern outreach force a rethink in the West on sanctions?

title: Bruhat, Vishala and many more: Writers offer alternatives to ‘greater’
content: Karnataka govt. faced backlash from the Opposition and sparked a social media debate for using the English word ‘Greater’ instead of a Kannada word while christening Greater Bengaluru Authority

title: Baramulla MP Engineer Rashid attacked in Tihar: Awami Ittehad Party
content: According to the AIP spokesman, Rashid spoke to his counsel, Advocate Javeed Hubbi, about “harassment” inside the jail

title: Crops on 14.44 lakh hectares damaged by heavy rain, says Maharashtra government
content: Excessive monsoon showers between August 15-20 have hit 191 talukas, damaging kharif crops in 654 revenue circles, says State Agriculture Minister

title: Comparing Bihar with beedi is shameful, the BJP says
content: ‘An attack is being made directly on the identity of Bihar and its people,’ former Union Minister and BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said of the since deleted post by the Congress’s Kerala unit

title: A.P. CM orders urgent steps to find cause of Turakapalem deaths, take up remedial action
content: Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to treat it as a health emergency and send special medical teams to the village to screen every resident and prepare a health profile to tackle the scourge

title: Congress in Kerala apologises after ‘Beedis and Bihar’ post backfires
content: In an attempt to pull off a sardonic wordplay depicting the proposed lower tax on beedis as a bid to entice rural voters, the INC@Kerala wrote on X: “Bidis and Bihar start with B. Cannot be considered sin anymore”

title: Teachers are architects of society, says Chittoor Collector
content: He urges teachers to guide underprivileged children, instil values, and protect students from negative influences during Teachers’ Day celebrations

title: Vidya Parirakshana Cycle Yatra highlights students’ issues in Prakasam
content: The eight-day yatra, covering 380 km across the district, draws attention to delayed fee reimbursements, high hostel charges, and challenges faced by students under the new National Education Policy

title: GST relief, subsidies, and innovations boost Andhra Pradesh’s livestock and poultry sector, says official
content: ‘Government initiatives are helping farmers increase milk and meat production, expand poultry operations, and strengthen biosecurity measures across the State’

title: CM welcomes revamped GST rates, but says the benefits should reach common man
content: If the benefits fail to reach the common man, the blame will rest squarely on the Union government: Siddaramaiah

title: Recent recusals in Supreme Court, HC, tribunal send mixed signals on transparency
content: No formal rules govern recusals by judges; SC judge M.M. Sundresh recently exited bail plea case  without providing any reason; bucking the trend, NCLAT judge, M.P. HC judge opted for transparency

title: Five workers missing after water release from dam floods Gujarat hydropower plant
content: The police say there were 15 workers on maintenance duty inside a 60-ft deep well in the plant when water was released from the Kadana dam upstream. While 10 of them managed to escape, five people are yet to be traced.

title: EAGLE chief warns students against drug use
content: He highlights cases of students caught in drug-related offences and urges youth to stay vigilant and report peddlers via WhatsApp

title: Jaishankar to join Brazil-led BRICS virtual summit on Trump tariffs: MEA
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will attend summit called by Brazil President Lula; the meet is likely to irk Washington that views the BRICS as “anti-American”

title: Himachal CM slams BJP leaders for not helping disaster-hit residents
content: Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu says State government has requested Centre to provide ‘one bigha’ of forest land to each affected family to help them resettle in safer locations

title: Kuppam police take action against false social media posts on Krishna waters
content: Officials say HNSS canals are supplying water as scheduled, dismissing disruption reports as baseless

title: Modi government has made a mockery of MGNREGA by chronically underfunding it: Jairam Ramesh
content: On the 20th anniversary of MGNREGA, the Congress general secretary says the scheme has been underfunded for the last 11 years and the budget has not been hiked for the last three years despite high inflation. This latest crisis is not an aberration but a reflection of a larger attempt by the government to throttle the scheme, he says

title: IT Minister Lokesh seeks Prime Minister Modi’s support for development of Andhra Pradesh
content: Expressing gratitude for approving an ASIP semiconductor unit in the State, he seeks the Centre’s help in tapping the potential of IT, Electronics and Communications sector

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. denies purchasing new helicopter for Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: With the security agencies flagging concerns over the existing one developing technical glitches often, an advanced Airbus H160 helicopter has been taken on lease to not only cut travel time but also save costs, say CMO officials

title: India unveils roadmap to strengthen nuclear deterrence, drone warfare capabilities
content: The document titled Technology Perspective and Capability Roadmap (TPCR-2025), a 15-year blueprint for military preparedness, highlights measures to ensure credible nuclear deterrence

title: Congress is ‘home of fake Gandhis’, says BJP A.P. president
content: Calling for regular forums that enable leaders to understand public opinion and shape better policies, P.V.N. Madhav says, every problem has a solution when people and leaders discuss it together

title: ‘Super Six’ promises a big hit with people, says Excise Minister
content: Kollu Ravindra highlights key welfare schemes and achievements of the coalition government within its first year in office

title: Agriculture Minister asks Collectors to closely monitor urea supply, availability and distribution
content: Atchannaidu also instructs officials to divert stocks from the surplus areas to the regions facing shortage

title: Septuagenarian Army veteran from Bengaluru completes Arctic expedition
content: The Army veteran commenced the expedition from Longyearbyen in Norway on the ship, Polar Quest, along with a group of 48 people, on August 22

title: Health Emergency In Andhra Village After 'Mysterious Illness' Kills 20
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Friday declared a health emergency in a village in Guntur district and sent high-level medical teams to investigate after a 'mysterious illness' claimed the lives of at least 20 people in two months.

title: BJP Vs Trinamool As Kolkata Gives Controversial Film 'Bengal Files' A Miss
content: The hugely controversial film "Bengal Files" was released today amid a huge political row between the state's Opposition BJP and the ruling Trinamool Congress.

title: 21,000 Cops Deployed In Mumbai For Ganesh Immersions, AI To Manage Routes
content: More than 21,000 police personnel will be deployed in Mumbai to maintain law and order during idol immersions on Anant Chaturdashi, the tenth and final day of the Ganesh festival, officials said on Friday.

title: Wife Living In Adultery Not Entitled To Maintenance: Delhi Court
content: Rejecting a divorced woman's plea seeking financial assistance, a Delhi court has observed that a wife living in adultery is not entitled to any maintenance from her husband.

title: Glacier Melting In Arunachal Pradesh Sparks Fears Of Lake Outburst Floods
content: Rapid melting of glaciers in the Eastern Himalayas in Arunachal Pradesh has raised concerns, with a record 1.5 metre melting of ice measured by scientists using vertical stakes

title: 2 Arrested For Selling Rotten Meat In J&K's Ganderbal, Cases Filed In Several Districts
content: Two persons were arrested for allegedly selling rotten meat and expired eatables in Jammu and Kashmir's Ganderbal district on Friday, police said.

title: 'No Reduction In Overall Cargo Shipments From India': Union Minister
content: Amid concerns over the impact of a 50 per cent US tariff on Indian products, Union Ports Shipping and Waterways Minister Sarbananda Sonowal on Friday claimed that there has been no reduction in overall cargo shipments from India.

title: Siddaramaiah Downplays Demand For Anti-Terror Agency's Probe In Dharmasthala Case
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Friday downplayed calls for a National Investigation Agency (NIA) probe into allegations of multiple murders, rapes and burials in Dharmasthala

title: 'The War Continued Beyond May 10': Army Chief On Operation Sindoor
content: Army Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi on Friday released a book on Operation Sindoor and underlined that it delves into the political clarity, and interpretation of "full freedom" which was given to the armed forces

title: Engineer Rashid's Party Claims Big Attack In Tihar, Sources Say Minor Injuries
content: Jailed MP Engineer Rashid's party has claimed there has been a deliberate attack on him inside Tihar Jail, which could have been fatal. Dismissing talk of any murderous intent, jail sources said he was beaten up by some inmates after an argument.

title: Video: Daring Jail Break In Andhra Pradesh, Prisoner Targets Warden
content: Two prisoners, Nakka Ravikumar and Bezawada Ramu, have escaped from the Chodavaram Sub-Jail in Anakapalli district of Andhra Pradesh. Their dramatic escape was caught on camera and a manhunt has been launched for them.

title: Tesla Offered Musk $1,000,000,000,000. He Still Made "Threats" To Quit
content: A $1 trillion pay package isnt simple to construct: A Tesla Inc. committee met with Elon Musk 10 times, delayed the companys annual meeting and enlisted six outside advisers before finalising the plan.

title: Ashoka Emblem At J&K's Hazratbal Shrine Damaged, BJP Says "Terrorist Act"
content: Angry worshippers at Jammu and Kashmir's Hazratbal shrine defiled the national emblem on a plaque placed outside the main prayer room.

title: "No Comments": Foreign Ministry On Trump's Remark On India, Russia, China
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday declined to comment on US President Donald Trump's latest remarks in which he mentioned India, Russia and China.

title: President Murmu Confers National Awards To 81 Teachers For Unique Methods
content: From creating palm leaf manuscripts for the class, setting up a neuropsychology lab, the unique teaching methods of 81 educators have bagged them the National Teachers Awards this year.

title: "Underestimated The Intercourse": Punjab Man's Hilarious Take On Floods
content: A video of a man attempting to discuss the recent devastating floods in Punjab has gone viral. His unclear speech and overwhelming confidence have left netizens amused and baffled at the same time.

title: Man Injured In Acid Attack By His Girlfriend's Brother In UP
content: A man was beaten and attacked with acid in a village under Bansbeeh police station area here, allegedly by his girlfriend's brother and several others, police said on Friday.

title: "India Will Say Sorry In 2 Months": Top US Official's Big Claim On Tariffs
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that despite India owning a strong stance against giving in to US pressure to not buy Russian oil, it will eventually come back to make a trade deal with Washington in a few months.

title: "Sharing Flood Data With Pakistan On Humanitarian Grounds": Foreign Ministry
content: India on Friday said it has been sharing flood data with Pakistan through diplomatic channels on humanitarian ground even as the Indus Water Treaty remains suspended.

title: PM Modi To Soon Visit Flood-Affected Areas: Sources
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will soon visit flood-affected states to take stock of the situation, official sources said on Friday.

title: Which countries can book a place at the World Cup this week?
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're a long way from discovering the list of 45 nations who will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the full field of 48 . japan were the very first country to qualify on March 20 .

title: US Open rescue pup wins over Sabalenka, finds home with Muhammad
